alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Lynn Canal (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 6:02PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...The following area, the Haines Highway northwest of Haines. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 540 PM AKDT, minor flooding is occurring periodically between mile post 14 and 16 of the Haines Highway. - For Chilkat River at Klukwan: At 5:00pm the stage was 126.36 feet. Flood Stage is 128.0 feet. Forecast: The most likely times for flooding will be during the morning hours. Water levels will rise from late this weekend into early next week as temperatures begin warming toward near record levels. Impacts: At 127.0 feet: This is bankfull stage, but water can encroach the Haines Highway, south of Klukwan. Note that the Chilkat River is highly braided, if and when it shifts channels, our present bankfull and flood stages will be outdated.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
